sub_title: International consultant and researcher at DBMresearch
summary:
Daniëlle de Winter is owner and lead consultant at DBMresearch. At the company, she aims to create new combinations of people and resources that improve an organization's capacity to address the issues the world faces. The focus is not on research for the sake of research - as more knowledge does not mean better practice - but on achieving change. DBMresearch believes in the value of both theory and practice, and how the combination can help us achieve positive change in what matters most. 

Daniëlle offers services as a knowledge broker in a wide-range of fields related to matters of development. Currently, she offers research assistance and advisory support to a variety of organizations and institutions working in the field of corporate social responsibility, human rights, gender, and knowledge management. 

DBMresearch is always eager to learn of new possibilities for cooperation and participation. Please get in touch with Daniëlle if you would like to discuss any new possibilities for collaboration.

What you can expect: 
- implementing research activities, home-based and in the field
- conducting scoping studies, assessments and evaluations
- support in theory & practice analysis and knowledge (co-)creation
- improving knowledge management
- high quality writing and editorial work

treasury_media.title: IT4D 33 showcases.pdf
treasury_media.description: Publication following study on inspiring examples MoFA supported projects at the crossroads of Digitalization and Development.

profile_positions.description: For the 'Work: No Child's Business' programme, I am involved as MEAL advisor to support UNICEF and partners in realizing, capturing and learning from their programmatic goals and interventions towards the elimination of child labour by 2025. As part of the MEAL working group of the multi-annual, multi-country programme, I will provide support in outcome harvesting, Theory of Change reflections, and overall MEAL work.
profile_positions.title: MEAL advisor Work: No Child's Business

profile_positions.description: I offer services as an independent knowledge broker in a wide-range of fields related to matters of development. Currently, I offer research assistance and support to a variety of organizations and insitutes working in the field of corporate social responsibility, gender and knowledge management.  I am always eager to learn of new possibilities for cooperation and participation.
profile_positions.title: Researcher & consultant

profile_positions.description: The synthesis study of the NL-CGIAR research programme brings together new knowledge and insights generated by the NL-CGIAR projects and experts. The study was conducted by Daniëlle de Winter and dr. Ellen Lammers in 2022. It addresses three key themes in food system thinking today: the role of the public sector in food system transformation, the diversity of smallholders in agri-food value chains, and the merits and dilemmas of public-private partnerships in international agricultural research.
profile_positions.title: Synthesis study: NL-CGIAR research programme

profile_positions.description: STITCH aims to create a new normal for the garment industry. I will be co-developing the PMEL framework and plan for the coming 5 years for the partnership. Fair Wear has joined forces with the British Ethical Trading Initiative (ETI), the Center for Development and Integration in Vietnam (CDI), labour organisation Cividep India and Dutch trade unions CNV Internationaal and Mondiaal FNV.
profile_positions.title: PMEL advisor STITCH Sustainable Textile Initiative: Together for Change

profile_positions.description: For Justice & Peace, I am implementing the impact study of Shelter City programme. The programme was initiated nearly 10 years ago and was designed with and for human rights defenders to support them to improve and expand their human rights work. Now, a decade later, JP wishes to explore the impact that was achieved through their activities.
profile_positions.title: Impact Researcher: Human Rights Defenders programme ShelterCity

profile_positions.description: DBMresearch was involved in capturing four out of eight StartImpuls project stories for the Dutch Research Council. Based on interviews and desk research, short stories were developed to showcase to what extent and how the StartImpuls programme supported scientific research that aimed to contribute to answering pressing societal questions.
profile_positions.title: Research & Writer: StartImpuls Dutch National Research Agenda

profile_positions.description: The Synthesis Study captured the lessons learned and experiences shared across the research projects of the SURe programme - Science for Using Research. The deliverables of the study included a podcast series (now live on Spotify 'Science for Using Research') accompanying booklet (forthcoming 2022).
profile_positions.title: Synthesis Study: Science for Using Research (SURe) programme

profile_positions.description: NWO WOTRO has been providing support to +70 projects under their Applied Research Fund and Global Challenges Programme to stimulate new insights and improved practices in the field of Food & Business. Together with the Food & Business Knowledge Platform (F&BKP), they have supported and encouraged multi-stakeholder research groups to bring out inspiring new knowledge and insights and help them translate these findings into policy and practice. DBMresearch is involved in synthesizing the key insights for a selection of thematic areas, outcomes and approaches that have been taken on. Key tasks will involve desk study, field work (Africa & Asia), learning sessions and working closely with thematic experts.
profile_positions.title: Research: Synthesis study Food & Business

profile_positions.description: For PAX, I facilitated several reflection workshops with staff members from the different Alliance partners of the Freedom from Fear alliance. The sessions were organized online and served the purpose of both gathering outcomes and lessons learned over the course of the last five years of the programme, while at the same time encouraging learning and identifying new opportunities for the future.
profile_positions.title: Learning Facilitator Freedom from Fear Alliance

profile_positions.description: Fairphone is working on tackling child labour in Uganda by working closely with ASM gold mining communities and supporting responsible gold sourcing into the electronics industry supply chains. For the project 'Joint Forces to Tackle Child Labour: From Gold Mines to Electronics', DBMresearch will conduct an endline evaluation of the effectiveness and the extent to which the project was able to proactively support more responsible gold sourcing in Uganda.
profile_positions.title: Final Evaluation Anti-Child Labour project

profile_positions.description: Beyond Beans is a Foundation established by ETG and dedicated to developing and implementing projects across ETG’s commodity supply chains in collaboration with partner companies, NGOs and government agencies. It is currently implementing a child labour remediation project in their cocoa supply chain in Ghana, called VSLA+CHILD, funded by the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO), under the Funds against Child Labour (FBK). With the support from Hivos and Lino Consulting, I will be involved in offering an expert review of the project's MEL approach, in particular the Child Labour monitoring tools. Tasks will include: reviewing indicator framework (and ToC), reviewing survey questions, processes and methods. This will be complemented by a field visit to the project location to assess execution in the field (if C19 restrictions permit).
profile_positions.title: MEL advisor 'Child Labour Remediation' project in the cocoa supply chain

profile_positions.description: I will be exploring inspirational examples of Digitalization & Development projects and programmes together with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in The Netherlands. For topics such Human Rights, Gender, Food Security, Migration and Humanitarian Assistance - together with my team - I will be exploring how digital solutions have been introduced to government supported programmes to enhance their impact across the globe.
profile_positions.title: Research 'Digitalization & Development'
